## PathUtils.normalize() method

Normalizes a path by collapsing redundant slashes, removing "." segments, and resolving ".." segments.

Rules: - Multiple consecutive "/" are collapsed into a single "/". - "." segments are removed. - ".." removes the previous segment (no-op at root). - The result always starts with "/" (absolute form).

Example: - normalize('/a//b/./c/../d') -<!-- -->&gt; '/a/b/d'

**Signature:**

```typescript
static normalize(path: string): string;
```

</td><td>

</td><td>

Input path (relative or absolute).


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

string

The normalized absolute path (always starting with "/").
